titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John Sauner and George Kintner, Indictment
CWG7598

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
McCracken Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
John Sauner & Geo. Kintner

The Grand Jury of McCracken County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Jno Sauner & Geo Kintner (proprietors of the Continental Hotel) of the offense of Keeping a gaming house committed as follows Viz -- The said John Sauner & Geo Kintner did on the 1st day of May 1865 in the County aforesaid, suffer and permit a game of Cards at which money, bank bills & property of value was bet won and lost, to be played in the Continental Hotel a house under their control against the Peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Witnesses
W. K. Harris
William Johnson
William Sullivan
Stanley Brown
John Strow
Jno Strow
John Hord
Frank Harlan

"Endorsed"
A. true Bill
J. G Cole
Foreman
Bail is fixed on this Indictment at Two hundred Dollars for each Deft

A. Copy. attest
B. Small Clk
By. Henry C. Yeiser D C"

Coml
vs } G House
Jno. Sauner & others
